member.name: M:ISP.Presentation.Forms.frmAccount.PreFilterMessage(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: Filters out a message before it is dispatched.
member.param: The message to be dispatched. You cannot modify this message.
member.returns: true to filter the message and stop it from being dispatched; false to allow the message to continue to the next filter or control.
member.remarks: Use to filter out a message before it is dispatched to a control or form. For example, to stop the Click event of a Button control from being dispatched to the control, you implement the method and return a true value when the Click message occurs. You can also use this method to perform code work that you might need to do before the message is dispatched.

member.name: P:ISP.Presentation.Forms.frmTask.IsFillingComponents
member.summary: Identifies if the form is in the process of initialing setting fields.
member.remarks: This is to ensure that events like SelectedIndexChanged don't overwrite data that was supposed to have been set when constructing the form.

member.name: M:ISP.Presentation.Forms.frmFund.UpdateLayoutAfterDelay(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Updates the layout of the specified control after a delay of 100 milliseconds. Will reset if the method is called before it reaches 100 milliseconds.
member.param: Used to resume the layout after the delay.
member.remarks: Took me forever to figure out! I needed to update the control with a delay so that the control would scroll smoothly with . Panels try to add and immediately remove the scroll bar when the vertical scrollbar value is changed, which makes it not scroll smoothly. This delays it long enough to not see this shutter.

member.name: M:ISP.Presentation.Forms.frmFund._updatePanelTimer_Tick(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Resumes the layout of on tick.

member.name: M:ISP.Presentation.Forms.frmMain.LoginCurrentUser
member.summary: Gets the security status of the current user and enables features based on their status.
member.returns: true if the current user has sufficient permission to use the application.
member.remarks: This method uses the to grab security roles from the Data Integration Hub on PCI-DB. It closes frmMain if an error occurs.

member.name: M:ISP.Presentation.Forms.frmMain.frmError_FormClosedEventHandler(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.FormClosedEventArgs)
member.summary: Closes when is closed.
member.param: Provides a reference to the frmError sender instance.
Provides data for the System.Windows.Forms.Form.FormClosed event.
member.remarks: This should only be used when the thrown exception would prevent the user from using the application. For example, if the application could not connect to the database or if the current user could not be logged in, then the form should be closed because it would be unusable.

member.name: M:ISP.Presentation.Forms.frmMain.LoadTasksControls
member.summary: Enables, disables and sets values of task-related controls based on their intrinsic availability.
member.remarks: We have this because we don't want users to attempt to do intrinsically irrational actions. For example, if CurrentCell is null and no record is selected, we don't want users to be able to click on a button that allows the user to edit that record.
